case_title: MUHAMMAD AND OTHERS vs MUHAMMAD ROSHAN AND OTHERS
complaint_summary: The petitioners filed for correction of Khasra Girdawari entries for specific land parcels under Land Reforms.
investigation_summary: The District Collector, Mianwali, accepted the petitioners' application for correction of Khasra Girdawari entries. The respondents appealed to the Additional Commissioner (Consolidation), Sargodha Division, who overturned the District Collector's decision citing inordinate delay in filing the application.

initial_order.action: Accepted application for correction of Khasra Girdawari

appeal_order.reason: Application made after more than 10 years with no justification for delay

final_decision.action: Maintained appeal order and dismissed revision petition in limine

legal_arguments: The application for correction of Khasra Girdawari was made after an inordinate delay of over 10 years.
The Additional Commissioner observed that there was no justification for accepting the application under Land Reforms.
key_issues: Delay in filing application for correction of Khasra Girdawari.
Validity of the District Collector's order under Land Reforms.

legal_terms.Khasra Girdawari: A record of land cultivation and ownership.
legal_terms.Land Reforms: Legal measures aimed at redistributing land ownership.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a revision petition concerning land record corrections under Land Reforms. The petition was dismissed due to unjustified delay in filing the application.
